text: The Canal Museum () is a museum in Anping District, Tainan, Taiwan. ==History== The museum building was originally constructed in 1926 as the Anping Customs building. It was the place where docked ships paid tariffs when arriving or leaving Anping. It was declared a historical building and converted into the Canal Museum in 2003. ==Architecture== The museum building is a Japanese-style building with two banyan trees in front yard and decorated with black brick roof and red brick wall. ==Opening time== The museum is open during weekends from 10:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. ==See also== * List of museums in Taiwan ==References== Category:2003 establishments in Taiwan Category:Museums in Tainan
title: Canal Museum (Taiwan)
